pageTitle: Hungary Genealogical Word List | Learn | FamilySearch.org
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {662=Hungarian is unrelated to most European languages and only remotely related to Finnish and Estonian. Hungarian was used along with Latin and German in the records of all areas of the old kingdom of Hungary before 1918. This includes present-day Hungary, Slovakia, southwestern Ukraine, western Romania, Serbia, Croatia and the easternmost part of Austria. To read Hungarian records in these languages, use the Latin Genealogical Word List (34077) and German Genealogical Word List (34067). In addition, the Hungarian language may be found in the records of Hungarian communities in the United States, Canada, and other areas settled by Hungarians.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {13558=Bizonfy, Ferenc. Angol-magyar szótár; Magyarangol szótár (English-Hungarian dictionary; Hungarian-English dictionary). Cleveland, Ohio: Liberty Pub., 1956. (FHL film1045410; item 1.), 114998=július huszonötödikén Az Úrnak ezernyolcszázharminchatodik esztendejében = on the twenty-fifth of July in the year of Our Lord one thousand eight hundred thirty and six, 13183=This word list includes only the words most commonly found in genealogical sources. For further help, use a Hungarian-English dictionary. Several are available at the Family History Library in the European collection. The call numbers begin with 494.511321.}
textBeforeTable: Spelling and Pronunciation Hungarian has several letter combinations that may be unfamiliar to English speakers and some letters are pronounced differently than in English (see the examples below). Because spelling rules were not standardized in earlier centuries, spelling varies in old records. Spelling and Pronunciation The letters q, w and x are not used in Hungarian, but may appear in some foreign words. Vowels can include length marks (á, é, í, ó, ö, ú, ) but these marks do not affect alphabetical order. This word list follows the standard English alphabetical order. However, when working with a Hungarian dictionary or alphabetized Hungarian records, use the Hungarian alphabetical order. o ö p q r s sz t ty u ü v w x y z zs a b c cs d e f g gy h i j k l ly m n ny Hungarian dictionaries and indexes use the following alphabetical order: The Hungarian alphabet is different from the English alphabet. Some letter combinations are considered as distinct letters. There are also two vowels not found in English: ö and ü. Alphabetical Order to the city város, városhoz to, towards -hoz, -hez, -höz for the girl lány, lányért for -ért was born születni, született (past tense)
